text: Adria Airways was the national airline of Slovenia. It began on 14 March 1961 and ended on 30 September 2019. In 1969, it bought its first jet aircraft, the Douglas DC-9. In December 1981, an Adria airplane crashed in Corsica. The crash killed 180 people. Adria bought its first Airbus A320 in 1989. As of June 2015, Adria has 12 airplanes. ==References== Category:1961 establishments in Europe Category:20th-century establishments in Slovenia Category:2019 disestablishments in Europe Category:Defunct airlines of Europe
title: Adria Airways
